OOC: I'm trying to get rid of those three so I can eventually bring in
other chars. Just help me on that! :)

BIC:

Ragnar: Ah! That is similar to the technology we use. Now, I think
that if we can modify a shuttle with some of these elements, we may be
able to go back.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
<cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> OOC: This is partly conjecture on my part.  Anyone who knows more 
> about the pseudo-science behind this, feel free to correct me.
> 
> "Well, we use a device called the transwarp drive." Jackie 
> explains.  "It creates a fold in the fabric of space-time, allowing 
> us to travel incredible distances in a relatively brief period.  It 
> requires some precise calculations to keep from flying right into 
> something on the other side, but that's what computers are for.  The 
> gizmo also doubles as a time machine of sorts."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Ragnar: So, how do you travel so far between the stars and how do 
> you
> > jump in the past?
